Would it be convenient to schedule a time after the New Year holiday for a detailed explanation?
Mom, I've arrived at the market. The strawberries and cherries both look really fresh. Do you want me to buy more? Which brand of non-alcoholic sparkling wine is better?
Just buy the brand your dad likes. Get two boxes of strawberries and one pound of cherries. We'll have dinner when you get back.
Remember to discuss the home renovation tonight. I have a bank interview in the afternoon, so I might be home a bit later.
A Ling: Xiaowei, the company's environmental protection activity starts today. Did you bring your new eco-friendly cup? I forgot to wash mine and have to use a paper cup instead. How embarrassing.
summarized_info: I received a text message from my colleague A Ling, asking if I had brought my newly purchased eco-friendly cup to the company's environmental protection event.

message_content: Xiaofeng, regarding the family gathering, I've just come up with some initial ideas. When you're available, we can discuss the specific arrangements over the phone, such as the time and location.
Weiming: Xiaowei, have you finished your morning yoga stretches? Breakfast is almost ready, and remember to remind me to reschedule the appointment with the charity.
Weiming, I'm taking Yuxin to rest near the exit of It's a Small World. How was your time at the Mad Hatter's Tea Cups? Remember to take some photos.

I really enjoyed our chat today! I totally relate to what you mentioned about those running shoes. Mine have been in service for almost two years now, and the soles are visibly worn out. The bounce is practically gone, and they feel stiff and hard when I run. It’s definitely time to retire them.
I (Yu Xiaowei): Su Lishan, meet at Hennessy Road for lunch tomorrow, and remember to bring the product information.

Dear Manager Li, 

Please find the equity incentive document I just sent to you. Thank you very much for your time this afternoon, and I look forward to the follow-up planning proposal.

Liang Zhenhua: Xiaowei, the minutes of today's interview have been sent to your email. I want to reiterate that I will give you my full support for your bid to become the regional sales manager next year. This is my clear commitment to your career development. Let's proceed as planned.

Peiwen, good morning. I checked the weather, and it's too foggy, so I've changed today's outdoor run to a gym session. I just finished the Chinese breakfast my mom prepared, feeling full of energy and ready to go. Let's plan for an outdoor run next time!
If you need to shower after running, you can use the shower facilities at the gym near the company. Don't forget to bring a towel.
Xiaowei, the pineapple bun from yesterday's afternoon tea was really good, don't you think?

Teacher Wu: @everyone Hello fellow embroidery enthusiasts, it's been a while since I last shared any work in the group. I've been organizing some old patterns lately. Has anyone been working on any new creations recently?
contactName: Cantonese Embroidery Interest Group (Wu Xiuying, He Meiling, etc.)

message_content: He Meiling: Hello, Teacher Wu! Hello, everyone! I recently finished a new piece and wanted to try something different.
contactName: Cantonese Embroidery Interest Group (Wu Xiuying, He Meiling, etc.)

message_content: He Meiling: I used the traditional peony pattern but combined its outline with the lines of the "Spring Bamboo" (which is the China Resources Tower) in Shenzhen Bay to create a modern-style wall hanging.
contactName: Cantonese Embroidery Interest Group (Wu Xiuying, He Meiling, etc.)

message_content: Yu Xiaowei: @He Meiling Wow! This idea is amazing! Combining traditional and modern landmarks sounds so artistic. Take some photos and show us!
contactName: Cantonese Embroidery Interest Group (Wu Xiuying, He Meiling, etc.)

message_content: He Meiling: [Image] The photo isn't great; the actual colors are more vibrant. The main idea is to convey a sense of being rooted in tradition while growing in a modern city.
contactName: Cantonese Embroidery Interest Group (Wu Xiuying, He Meiling, etc.)

message_content: Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you been busy lately? How are Xuanxuan and Xinxin doing?
Yu Xiaowei: Not bad, just a bit tired from dealing with many client matters at the end of the year. The kids are all asleep. I just finished my yoga and want to light some aromatherapy to relax.
Lin Jiaxin: What brand do you use? I've been looking into it recently.

Yu Xiaowei: I'm not too particular about brands, and I don't care much about whether the packaging is good-looking or not. What I value most is whether the scent can truly help me relax, and it would be even better if it has some sleep-inducing effects.
Yu Xiaowei: I really enjoy calm woody or herbal scents like lavender and sandalwood. As long as the fragrance diffuses adequately, it doesn't need to fill the entire room.
Lin Jiaxin: Got it, functionality comes first. The last time I bought one mainly because the bottle looked nice, but the scent was too strong, so I didn't use it much.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you heard? He Junjie's family recently had an incident.
Yu Xiaowei: Huh? What's up? I've been busy lately and haven't paid much attention to the class group.
Lin Jiaxin: It's his father. He was diagnosed with lung cancer during a physical examination last month. He is currently hospitalized at Queen Elizabeth Hospital.
Yu Xiaowei: Oh my God... That's serious. Uncle He has always been in good health. Ah Jie must be under a lot of pressure now, having to manage work and run to the hospital.

Lin Jiaxin: Yes, he recently told a few of us old classmates to see if there are any good medical resources or experiences with insurance claims that we can share. I remember you seem to have clients who are doctors?
Su Lishan: Xiaowei, are you going to Citygate Outlets this weekend? I heard there's a winter clothing sale, and I want to buy a down jacket for my daughter.
Yu Xiaowei: Great, I'd like to go take a look too. The weather has been getting cooler lately, and I want to buy a few new scarves.
Su Lishan: What kind do you want to buy? Cashmere is comfortable, but it's expensive.

Yu Xiaowei: I've recently become fascinated with scarves that incorporate traditional Cantonese embroidery elements. They have a silk-blend base with exquisite embroidery, featuring patterns like peonies and phoenixes. They're both elegant and carry our own cultural flavor. It's much more interesting than simply buying luxury brands.
Su Lishan: Wow, that sounds so special! Is it related to your study of Cantonese embroidery? Where can I buy something like that? I'd like to take a look too.
In the afternoon, I took my mom for a walk to the place where she used to teach. She shared many interesting stories from her early working days, and it felt like time had flown by.
I just bought some gold and red colored paper and ribbons to make Christmas decorations.
Su Lishan: Xiaowei, don't forget to bring the new regulation notes for lunch tomorrow. We'll focus on discussing that controversial clause.
Xiaowei, regarding the case improvement we discussed during lunch today, I think we can add some comparative data, focusing particularly on the coverage gap.
To myself: Starting next week, follow along with the news recordings from CCTV Finance every week and persistently improve pronunciation.
Mom, did you buy my dinosaur clothes?
Me: Waiting at the community center. Just set up the pet feeder at home using the mobile app, no need to worry.
Su Li Shan: Today's lunchtime English practice at Wah Sing Cafe was really rewarding! Especially when discussing American TV shows, the way you corrected my pronunciation was very effective.
Mom, I'd like to talk during breakfast. You seem to have been really busy lately and haven't had time to play with me.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you heard? Ah Hui (Huang Wenhui) has some great news over there!
Yu Xiaowei: Really? What good news? She didn't mention it in our group chat with the three of us.

Lin Jiaxin: She just told me in a private chat that the internal promotion results are out, and she got promoted! She went from product manager to senior product director, responsible for the entire product line in the South China region.
Yu Xiaowei: Wow! That's amazing! Ah Hui has always been so hardworking. She must be over the moon.

Lin Jiaxin: Yes, she said that besides the promotion, the company also rewarded her with a batch of stock options as recognition for her performance over the past few years. However, she mentioned that the pressure will be greater from now on. Should we schedule a time to properly celebrate with her, either when she returns to Hong Kong or when we go to Shenzhen?

Su Lishan: Sister Xiaowei, there's a new sci-fi film called "Stellar Journey" that just came out. I heard the special effects are amazing and it has great reviews. Do you want to go see it together this weekend?

Yu Xiaowei: Shanshan, thank you for the invitation. But to be honest, I'm not really into those sci-fi movies with all the flying around and fighting. After watching them, I always feel like they're too far removed from real life, and it's a bit exhausting.
Su Lishan: Haha, I understand. So what kind of movies do you like? I heard there's also a mystery film called "Mist Pursuit" that's been getting good reviews lately.

Yu Xiaowei: I don't watch many suspense films either—they require too much thinking, and I just want to relax after work. Actually, I prefer lighthearted family comedies, like the recent Hong Kong film "All's Well, Ends Well 2024," which depicts the daily life of a family. It warms my heart and lets me laugh together with Xuanxuan and Xinxin. How wonderful.
Su Lishan: Got it! Next time there's a family-friendly movie, I'll let you know right away. Or we could also revisit an old Hong Kong film.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you video called Ah Hui recently? She doesn't seem to be doing well.
Yu Xiaowei: We had a brief chat last week, and she said she was busy. What exactly is going on?

Lin Jiaxin: The new app she was in charge of had a high-profile launch last month, didn't it? But it ended up with low user ratings and a lot of complaints. Her team has been working frantically to fix it over the past month, but the pressure from above is immense.
Yu Xiaowei: Ah... no wonder. She's so strong-willed, it must be really hard for her.

Lin Jiaxin: Yes, she said she hasn't been able to sleep well for two or three weeks in a row. Every time she closes her eyes, all she can think about are negative user reviews and her boss's questioning. Yesterday, she even sighed to me, wondering if she's really cut out for the high-pressure environment at Tencent, where the stress feels endless and overwhelming.
Shen Peiwen: Xiaowei, see you at the weekend training! By the way, you mentioned wanting to change your sports headphones last time. Have you found any you like?
Yu Xiaowei: I've looked at a few models, but haven't made a final decision yet. The one I'm currently using always gets loose when I run, and I have to keep pressing it. It's so annoying.
Shen Peiwen: Me too! I hate having to adjust my gear while running. So what's your top priority when choosing headphones this time? Sound quality? Battery life?

Yu Xiaowei: Sound quality and battery life are certainly important, but for me, the top priority right now is 【comfort】. I must find a pair that feels like I'm wearing nothing at all, and no matter how much I run or sweat, they won't shift or fall out. Otherwise, no matter how good the music sounds, having to adjust them every few steps while running would ruin the experience.
Shen Peiwen: Got it! 'Light as air' and 'stable' are the key points. I'll help you keep an eye out for models with that kind of reputation.

Dear Manager Zhang, I am currently on my way to the hospital. I would like to confirm with you once again: what specific materials are required for my mother's insurance claim application for this hospitalization? Additionally, how long will the entire process take? Thank you!
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, Ah Hui has finally resolved her recent troubles and can breathe a sigh of relief.
Yu Xiaowei: Really? Last time I heard her say that the water leakage upstairs gave her a headache, and the ceiling even got moldy.
Lin Jiaxin: Yes, it's that apartment in Shenzhen. She said she communicated with the management office and the upstairs neighbor several times, but the other party initially refused to admit it.
Yu Xiaowei: How was it resolved later? Ah Hui has a good temper, but encountering such a situation must have been tough.

Lin Jiaxin: She asked a lawyer friend she knew to send a lawyer's letter, and the upstairs neighbor immediately backed down. They agreed to hire a professional to fix it and even compensated her with some money to repaint the ceiling. Finally, it's all sorted out.
Su Lishan: Sister Xiaowei, have you been following "After Marriage" lately? I watch it every night and can't bear to sleep.
Yu Xiaowei: Yes, I do. But I really can't stand the male lead Gan Yandong. He's so indecisive, dragging his feet and not knowing how to choose between two girls. It makes me so angry.
Su Li Shan: Haha, I think so too. He obviously likes Macy, but he doesn't dare to tell Ah Yan clearly, making all three of them suffer.
Yu Xiaowei: That's right, men need to be decisive. Like my husband, although he doesn't know how to say sweet words, he makes decisions very quickly.
Su Lishan: Brother Ming is a pragmatist. I heard the finale is tomorrow night. How about we video chat while watching and discussing it together?
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you been in touch with Ah Hui lately? She seems to be in a bit of a low mood.
Yu Xiaowei: I just had a video call with her last night. She is indeed a bit annoyed, saying that her sleep quality has been very poor lately.
Lin Jiaxin: Huh? Is it because of too much work pressure?

Yu Xiaowei: It's not about work. It's her neighbor in the new residential area in Shenzhen who has a big dog, like a Golden Retriever or something. That dog barks every night, making it impossible for her to sleep.
Lin Jiaxin: Wow, that must be really tough. She still has to go to work during the day; how can she manage without energy? Did she complain to the property management?
Shen Peiwen: Xiaowei, have you prepared your playlist for the long-distance training this weekend? Please share it. I'm getting tired of my old songs lately.
Yu Xiaowei: Haha, I've recently changed my taste! I used to listen to fast-paced pop songs, but now I find movie soundtracks particularly exciting.
Shen Peiwen: Movie soundtracks? For example?

Yu Xiaowei: Like "The Lord of the Rings" or "Interstellar"—grand and majestic. When I listen to them while running, I feel like I’m not just running on the road but completing some epic mission. It really helps me keep going. It’s much more layered than pure electronic music.
Shen Peiwen: Wow, that's a unique perspective! Let me give it a try. The grandeur of a symphony really does suit the emotional drive needed for long-distance running.

Xiaowei: I think the decision we talked about at breakfast is right. I won't go running for the next few days. I'll listen to you and Mom and go to the hospital for a check-up. Could you help me check which nearby hospital has good reviews for orthopedics or sports medicine at noon?

After dinner last night, I chatted with everyone, and the atmosphere was really great. I mustered up the courage to share a creative plan I had been contemplating for a long time—it was about Cantonese embroidery. Unexpectedly, you all were incredibly supportive, especially Mom, which made me feel that this idea held even greater significance. My heart felt warm, and I was filled with motivation.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you heard from Ahui? It seems there are some changes on her side.
Yu Xiaowei: Not yet. I've been busy with my child's schoolwork and following up with several clients recently. What's wrong with Ah Hui?

Lin Jiaxin: She mentioned in the group chat last night that Tencent is undergoing an organizational restructuring recently. Their entire product department is merging with another one, and everyone has to reapply for their positions. She's currently struggling with preparing the materials.
Yu Xiaowei: Oh, so sudden? I hope she can handle it smoothly. But she's so capable, there shouldn't be any problem. On our side, everything is as usual, just a bit more pressure on performance.
Lin Jiaxin: Yes, I hope she passes smoothly. Are we still having afternoon tea as usual this weekend?
Shen Peiwen: Good morning, Sister Xiaowei! Are you up for a long-distance training run this weekend? I'd like to try out a new route.
Yu Xiaowei: Great! I've been wanting to try out my newly bought sports headphones. The old ones kept falling off while running, and they often had poor contact when I sweated a lot.
Shen Peiwen: You got a new one? What brand did you buy? I've been looking at them recently too.

Yu Xiaowei: I didn't specifically choose a brand; I mainly looked at reviews. When I made my selection this time, I focused on two key points: first, the ear hook design must be secure, so it won't fall off no matter how much I run or jump; second, it must have a high waterproof and sweatproof rating—I don't want another one to break because of sweat. As for sound quality, it just needs to be decent enough to keep the rhythm while running.
Shen Peiwen: Got it! Stability and waterproofing are indeed the most important. I'll refer to your standards. So, see you at the usual place at 7 a.m. on Saturday?
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, are you busy? Ah Hui (Huang Wenhui) had a video call with me yesterday and shared some big news!
Yu Xiaowei: Just finished putting Xinxin to sleep. What big news? Did she get a promotion and a raise?
Lin Jiaxin: Even more impressive than that! She bought a new apartment in the Nanshan Science and Technology Park in Shenzhen! She said it's closer to the company and the environment is better.
Yu Xiaowei: Wow! I'm really happy for her! She has always been working very hard. But wasn't her original house also quite good?

Lin Jiaxin: She said she wants to improve her living conditions, and with the favorable policies for new energy vehicles in Shenzhen, she is still debating whether to take the opportunity to replace her car as well. She has her eye on a Tesla. However, all of this feels so far away from us. I’ll just stick to living in my public housing and driving my little Toyota.
Su Lishan: Sister Xiaowei, good afternoon! What good songs did you listen to on your commute today? Please recommend some; my playlist is running dry.
Yu Xiaowei: Shanshan, my taste has changed a bit lately. I used to listen to the pop charts on Hong Kong radio stations or some old songs.
Su Lishan: Oh? What's changed? It wouldn't be the K-pop that kids like Xuanxuan listen to, would it? Haha.

Yu Xiaowei: Not really! I was video chatting with my younger brother in Shenzhen (Yu Xiaofeng) earlier, and he played a few songs by mainland singers for me. I found that some folk songs are quite pleasant to listen to, with lyrics written in a very delicate way, as if telling a story.

Yu Xiaowei: For example, there's a singer named Mao Buyi. His songs like "Worry-Free" and "Someone Like Me" are on repeat when I do embroidery or relax at night recently. It feels like a different flavor compared to listening to Cantonese songs, but it's equally touching. You can give it a try.

Changsha Wan Community Center: Your meditation experience class has been successfully booked. Please attend at Changsha Wan Community Center, Fa Cheong Street, Sham Shui Po District, on March 22 at 14:00.
Su Lishan: Thank you for today's lunch! I came up with some ideas for the speech while walking, let's talk about it later.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, I've been feeling really down lately and wanted to talk to you.
Yu Xiaowei: Xinxin, what's wrong? What happened? I'm at home, you can call anytime.
Lin Jiaxin: It's about Ajie's company. They recently underwent internal restructuring, and his department was merged into another larger department.
Yu Xiaowei: Huh? What about his position then?

Lin Jiaxin: The original position is gone. They said all middle-level positions need to be re-competed for. From what I've heard, the internal competition is fierce. He doesn't have any connections, so he might not get the position. I'm so worried—what if he ends up unemployed?
Shen Peiwen: Xiaowei, are you going to run the new route at Ma’anshan this weekend? I heard the scenery is amazing.
Yu Xiaowei: Great! I've been wanting to try out my new sports headphones. The old ones kept slipping off while I was running, which was really annoying.
Shen Peiwen: You bought a new one again? What brand did you pick this time? I see many now focus on noise cancellation or ultra-long battery life.

Yu Xiaowei: Actually, both battery life and water resistance are fine as long as they meet basic needs. I spent a long time choosing this time, and what I value most is how securely it fits—it should feel as light as if I’m not wearing anything at all, and it shouldn’t fall off no matter how much I move while running. Sound quality isn’t the top priority for me.
Shen Peiwen: Got it! It's true, constantly adjusting headphones while running is really distracting. Looking forward to trying out your new gear this weekend!
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you chatted with Ah Hui recently? She seems to be in a bad mood.
Yu Xiaowei: Not yet. There are many clients this month, so I'm a bit busy. What's wrong with her? Something happened at home?
Lin Jiaxin: Not at home, but at work. Her company introduced a new assessment method at the beginning of the year, tying individual bonuses directly to the team's overall KPI.
Yu Xiaowei: Oh, this system doesn't seem very fair to someone as capable as Ah Hui.

Lin Jiaxin: Exactly! She said that their team recently took on two new members who are still in the training phase, which has slowed down the project progress and dragged down the overall team rating. Ah Hui herself has clearly exceeded her targets, but her bonus might be cut because of the team's lower score, so she's really frustrated.
Shen Peiwen: Xiaowei, are you going to run the new route at Ma'anshan this weekend? I just bought a pair of bone conduction headphones and want to test them out.

Yu Xiaowei: Great! I've also been looking at sports headphones lately. Battery life, waterproofing, and all those features are definitely important, but what I care about most is actually just one thing.
Shen Peiwen: Sound quality? Or connection stability?

Yu Xiaowei: Neither. It's about how securely they stay in place. My previous pair felt like they were about to fall out whenever I ran, and I constantly had to adjust them with my hands, which was really distracting. Now, when I choose headphones, the first thing I look at is whether their design truly keeps them snug in my ears, even during intense exercise. I can tolerate slightly worse sound quality, but constantly falling out is a deal-breaker.
Shen Peiwen: Got it! That's indeed a crucial point; it's so annoying when the earbuds fall out while running. I'll bring my new earbuds for you to try this weekend and see how stable they are.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you been in touch with Ah Hui lately? I feel like she's been talking less in the group chat recently.
Yu Xiaowei: Yes, I had a video call with her for half an hour last night. She has been under a lot of work pressure lately and looks quite worn out.
Lin Jiaxin: Huh? Hasn't she always been very capable? What happened over at Tencent?

Yu Xiaowei: She was entrusted with an important task this year, taking charge of a brand-new AI product line. Initially eager to make a big impact, she soon found herself facing one technical challenge after another, while the team was constantly debating whether the product should focus more on the B2B or B2C market.
Yu Xiaowei: The project progress is much slower than originally planned, and there is a lot of pressure from above. She said it feels like running in a quagmire, unable to exert any strength.

Su Lishan: Xiaowei, last time you mentioned wanting to enroll Xinxin in a music class. Have you made any progress? My daughter is learning piano, and her teacher is quite strict, making her practice finger techniques every day.
Yu Xiaowei: Still looking. I don't really want her to commit to learning a specific instrument at such a young age; it's too much pressure.
Su Lishan: That's true, Xinxin is only five years old. So, what are your thoughts?

Yu Xiaowei: I prefer a more comprehensive approach. That is, let children learn through play, listen to the sounds of different instruments, follow the music to beat time and dance, and first cultivate their overall sense of and interest in music.

Yu Xiaowei: There seems to be a music center in Kowloon Tong that offers this kind of course, called "Little Musician Paradise." I plan to take her there for a trial session this weekend. As for grading exams, we can think about that once she truly develops an interest.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you been in touch with Ah Hui recently? She seems to be in a low mood.

Yu Xiaowei: I video-called her last night. She's really annoyed. The apartment above her newly bought place is being renovated, and the sound of electric drills goes on from morning till night. It's been going on for almost a month.
Lin Jiarui: Wow, that's too bad. Doesn't she often have to hold video conferences at home?

Yu Xiaowei: Yeah, she said she couldn't concentrate on work at all and couldn't sleep well at night. She complained to the management several times, but it didn't help much. Luckily, we don't have that kind of problem here, otherwise I'd go crazy too.
Lin Jiaxin: Sigh, we can only hope that the upstairs renovations finish soon. Should we still invite her out for dinner next weekend?
Shen Peiwen: Sister Xiaowei, I've been thinking about switching to a sports headset recently. The one you wore during the marathon seems pretty good. Do you have any recommendations?
Yu Xiaowei: Ah Wen, I'm using XX brand bone conduction headphones. Sound quality and noise cancellation aren't really its strong points, but the battery life of about 10 hours is sufficient.

Yu Xiaowei: The main reason I chose it is that it's almost weightless when worn, and it won't fall off no matter how much I shake my head while running. As you know, when I run long distances, having my ears pressed or constantly worrying about the earbuds falling out can be really distracting. As for waterproofing, I think IPX4 is sufficient, since I'm not using it for swimming.
Shen Peiwen: Got it! Light and steady is the way to go. Thanks, Sister Xiaowei. I'll go look into this model!
He Meiling: Xiaowei, have you been in touch with Teacher Wu recently? I'm a bit worried about her.
Yu Xiaowei: I just visited her studio last Sunday. Alas, Teacher Wu is not in good shape.
He Meiling: What's wrong? Are you feeling unwell?

Yu Xiaowei: She says her eyesight is getting worse and worse, and it takes several attempts to thread a needle. You know she's preparing new works for the "Treasures of Lingnan" exhibition at the end of the year, right? The progress has been significantly delayed, and she's so anxious that she feels useless and frustrated, thinking she's getting old.
He Meiling: Ah, I see. Teacher Wu sets very high standards for herself. We should think of ways to help her, like looking for tools that can assist with threading needles?
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you been busy lately? It's been a long time since we last had afternoon tea together.
Yu Xiaowei: Yes, there are so many things to handle both at home and outside. But I've found a great way to relax, which is listening to music.
Lin Jiaxin: Didn't you used to love listening to pop songs? Have you changed your taste now?

Yu Xiaowei: It has completely changed. Ever since my mother fell ill, my mind has never been at peace. Now, before I go to bed at night or when I want to take a short nap at noon, I specifically look for pure music with sounds of rain, streams, or ocean waves to listen to.

Yu Xiaowei: In the app, it's called "white noise" or "meditation music." Listening to it really helps calm me down, as if it drowns out all the noise in my mind. It works better for me than just piano music.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you been busy lately? I have something on my mind and I'd like to talk to you about it.
Yu Xiaowei: Just finished putting the child to sleep. What's up, Xinxin? You don't sound too cheerful.
Lin Jiaxin: Sigh, it's about my husband's company. They've recently undergone an internal restructuring, merging his entire department into another larger department.
Yu Xiaowei: What? What about his position? Is there any impact?

Lin Jiaxin: It has a significant impact. His original position is gone, and he has to compete with other colleagues for positions in the new department. The most troublesome part is that the new department's office location will likely move from the current Kowloon to the New Territories. If that happens, his daily commute will take over an hour longer, which is really worrying.
Shen Peiwen: Xiaowei, are you up for a morning run this weekend? I've discovered an amazing new route!
Yu Xiaowei: Great! I've been wanting to try out my newly bought sports headphones.
Shen Peiwen: Did you buy new headphones again? Wasn't the previous pair pretty good?

Yu Xiaowei: The previous one kept getting loose while running, and I was worried about water damage when sweating a lot. This time, I spent a long time searching specifically for an ear-hook design with an IPX7 or higher waterproof rating. Sound quality and battery life are sufficient for me—the key is that it stays secure and is sweat-resistant.
Shen Peiwen: That makes sense! It's really annoying when earbuds fall out or get damaged by sweat during a run. The criteria you've chosen are very practical.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you been in touch with Mandy recently? I heard that something seems to have happened on her end.
Yu Xiaowei: Mandy? Zhou Minyi? No, we were just chatting in the group last week about our children's schooling. What happened to her?
Lin Jiaxin: I heard it from Ajie too. He said Mandy's company is laying off people recently, and it seems she got laid off.
Yu Xiaowei: Huh? So sudden! She was doing so well as a financial analyst at Tencent. How is she doing now?

Lin Jiaxin: Ajie said Mandy is feeling quite down. After all, there's a mortgage on the house, and the kids are still young. Losing income all of a sudden must be putting a lot of pressure on her. She's currently updating her resume and looking for a new job. Should we give her a call to cheer her up?
Suzanne: What to watch during lunch break? Any good drama recommendations lately?
Yu Xiaowei: I'm watching "The Golden Years," which is about the inheritance of Hong Kong's time-honored brands. Although the plot is a bit slow, it has a unique charm.
Su Lishan: Oh, my mom seems to have been following it. Which character appeals to you the most?

Yu Xiaowei: My favorite is Master Chen, the pastry chef. He has spent his whole life guarding that old shop, and his dedication to his craft reminds me of what Teacher Wu said when I was learning Cantonese embroidery. No matter how the outside world changes, some things must be passed down from generation to generation.
Su Lishan: I understand, this kind of role that adheres to tradition is quite touching. I'll go check it out tonight.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, Ah Hui seems to be in a low mood lately, she's been talking less in the group chat.
Yu Xiaowei: Really? I've been busy with my child's homework these past couple of days and haven't been paying close attention to the group chat. What happened to her?

Lin Jiaxin: She privately messaged me yesterday, saying that the company has a new boss who is particularly difficult to deal with. No matter what product proposal she submits, it gets rejected, and he always finds fault, which has put a lot of pressure on her.

Yu Xiaowei: Sigh, the pressure of working in the internet industry in Shenzhen is indeed quite high. But she is so capable, so she should be able to handle it. Let's comfort her more, after all, we can't offer much practical help from our side.
Lin Jiaxin: Yes, we can only offer spiritual support. I hope she adapts quickly, or that her boss gets transferred soon.
Su Lishan: Sister Xiaowei, shall we go to Lan Fong Yuen for lunch? I heard they have launched a new milk tea.
Yu Xiaowei: Great! But I've become more and more picky with food lately. I've tried many places, but I still think the old-fashioned way of cooking is the most satisfying.
Su Lishan: How do you say it? Which one do you like best now?

Yu Xiaowei: The tea base must be strong enough, and it should go down smoothly, not watery. The most crucial part is to slowly pull it through a silk stocking, then add evaporated milk. That aroma and texture cannot be replaced by fresh milk.
Su Lishan: Understood, seasoned tea connoisseur! Then let's head to that time-honored shop in Central, guaranteed to meet your high standards.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you been in touch with Ah Hui recently? I feel like she's been under a lot of pressure lately.
Yu Xiaowei: We had a video call last week, and she only mentioned that work was bothering her without going into details. What's up?

Lin Jiarui: She was complaining to me yesterday that in the new game project she's in charge of, several lead designers and lead programmers in the team have been arguing fiercely over the core gameplay, and no one can convince the others.

Lin Jiaxin: As a result, the project progress is stuck there, and the internal test originally scheduled for the end of this month is definitely not going to make it. As the product manager caught in the middle, she's completely overwhelmed.
Yu Xiaowei: Oh, no wonder. That's how the internet industry is—fast-paced and high-pressure. Let's find some time to video chat and comfort her.
Su Lishan: Xiaowei, are you free this weekend? I heard the special effects in the newly released "Star Trek: Reboot" are amazing. Want to go watch it together?
Yu Xiaowei: Science fiction movies... My husband might like them, so it would be okay to take him and Xuanxuan. As for me, I prefer something more lighthearted.
Su Lishan: What about "Hong Kong Family"? I heard it's packed with jokes, telling the comical misadventures of a family in Hong Kong.

Yu Xiaowei: This is great! I love family comedies the most, they are both funny and heartwarming. Or something like "You Are the Apple of My Eye" that talks about youth is also good, it can bring back memories.

Yu Xiaowei: Please don't ask me to watch any suspense films about locked-room murders or plots with twists and turns. I have to use my brain every day at work to calculate insurance coverage and returns for clients. When I watch a movie, I just want to completely relax and not have to think at all.
Su Lishan: Haha, got it! Let's settle on "Hong Kong Family Comedy" then, Saturday afternoon show?
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you chatted with Ah Hui recently? She seems to be in a bad mood.
Yu Xiaowei: Yes, I had a video call with her last night. She said she was almost driven crazy by her neighbor.
Lin Jiaxin: What's wrong? Is it a noise issue?
Yu Xiaowei: That's right. A new neighbor moved in next door to her and has a big dog, probably a Golden Retriever. That dog barks every night, keeping her awake.
Lin Jiaxin: Oh my, wouldn't that make you feel tired during the day? Ah Hui already has a lot of work pressure.
Yu Xiaowei: Yes, she said she's been dozing off in meetings lately and got a reminder from her boss. She's also worried about how to communicate with her neighbor.
Shen Peiwen: Xiaowei, what do you usually drink after a long run on weekends? There are so many sports drinks on the market that I’m overwhelmed.
Yu Xiaowei: I've tried quite a few, but now I've settled on a favorite. I always find the taste of those sports drinks with additives strange, and I just can't get used to them.
Shen Peiwen: Do you drink protein powder? I heard it's good for muscle recovery.
Yu Xiaowei: It's too sweet, and it's like a meal replacement. After running, I don't want to drink something so heavy. I prefer something more refreshing.
Shen Peiwen: Haha, I get it. Don’t tell me you went for a milk tea after your run?

Yu Xiaowei: Not really. Milk tea is for casual enjoyment, not for recovery. What I make most often now is honey lemon water, brewed with warm water. If I sweat a lot, I add a pinch of salt. It’s both thirst-quenching and energizing, and it feels the most comfortable.
Husband: The bank transaction went smoothly. The manager gave some advice on cash flow management, so we need to re-evaluate our financial planning.

Accompanying the kids in the park, are you free? I’d like to ask about museums and family-friendly venues suitable for children in the Greater Bay Area. Also, could you recommend some must-try restaurants in Shunde? Thank you!
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, Ah Hui seems to be in a bad mood lately. Have you talked to her?
Yu Xiaowei: I had a video call with her last night. She's really upset because the pre-sale apartment she bought in Shenzhen seems to have run into some issues.
Lin Jiaxin: Huh? What's the problem? I remember she bought it the year before last, saying it was near the Nanshan Science and Technology Park.

Yu Xiaowei: Yes, that's the property. She said the construction site has been shut down for several months, and rumors are spreading in the homeowners' group that the developer's funding chain has broken, possibly leading to an unfinished project. She has already paid the down payment and still has to continue making monthly mortgage payments, which is putting a lot of pressure on her.
Lin Jiaxin: Oh my god, this is so upsetting. We need to think about how to comfort her.
Shen Peiwen: Sister Xiaowei, the weekend long-distance run has been rescheduled to 7 a.m. on Sunday. We’ll meet at the Shing Mun River Promenade in Sha Tin. Is that okay?
Yu Xiaowei: Received, no problem. It's perfect timing to check out appliances after my run. My refrigerator is getting a bit old, I'm thinking of replacing it.
Shen Peiwen: What kind are you thinking of buying? Nowadays, many come with smart features and can connect to your phone.

Yu Xiaowei: I don't really care about whether it's smart or not. My dad and Mingzai aren't into new technology either. What matters most to me is how well the freshness preservation zones are designed.

Yu Xiaowei: The current refrigerator at home easily causes cross-contamination of odors when fruits and vegetables are stored together, and strawberries wilt after just two days. My mom goes to the market every day to buy fresh produce, so I hope to have an independent fruit and vegetable preservation area with adjustable humidity and temperature, allowing them to stay fresh for a few more days.
Shen Peiwen: Understood, practicality is key. My aunt's washing machine seems to have the features you mentioned. Let me ask her about the model for you.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, are you busy? What Ah Hui said in the group yesterday really cracked me up.
Yu Xiaowei: Just finished helping my child with homework. What's up? I didn't pay close attention to the group chat during yesterday's meeting.
Lin Jiaxin: It's just that she has been learning Cantonese embroidery at the community center in Shenzhen, and unlike our traditionalist Teacher Wu, she always likes to incorporate modern designs.

Lin Jiaxin: Guess what happened? Last week, she embroidered a piece that blended geometric patterns and actually managed to convince the teacher, who had always only taught traditional flowers and birds!
Yu Xiaowei: Haha, that's so typical of Ah Hui! So what happened next? Did the teacher get really angry?

Lin Jiaxin: No! Not only was the teacher not angry, but she also kept that piece of work, saying she would use it as an example in the next class to discuss the innovative possibilities of traditional craftsmanship. Ah Hui was so proud that she sent red envelopes in the group chat for a long time.
Shen Peiwen: Sister Xiaowei, my running headphones broke again. How is the brand you use? Any recommendations?

Yu Xiaowei: I just got a new pair last month. The most important thing is that they are light, so my ears don't get tired after wearing them for a long time. This is especially crucial during the second half of a marathon.
Yu Xiaowei: Then the battery life must be long. I often forget to charge it, so it needs to last through my three weekly training sessions plus commuting while listening to music.
Shen Peiwen: How about the sound quality? Is the noise cancellation good?

Yu Xiaowei: I actually don't want noise cancellation that's too strong. The ones I chose have a transparency mode, so with a press, I can hear the sounds of surrounding traffic. It's the same at home—when Xuanxuan and Xinxin call me, I can hear them right away. Safety and family come first, after all.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you been in touch with Ah Hui lately? She doesn't seem to be doing well.
Yu Xiaowei: We had a video call last week, and she seemed a bit tired. She mentioned that her project has been tight recently. What's going on?

Lin Jiaxin: More than just tired. She told me that the internet companies in Shenzhen are fiercely competitive, and she's been so stressed that she hasn't been able to sleep for several months. Her dark circles are really noticeable.
Yu Xiaowei: What? That serious? Did she go to see a doctor?

Lin Jiaxin: I did, but I didn't go to a Western doctor. Instead, I found an old traditional Chinese medicine practitioner for treatment, drinking herbal medicine and doing acupuncture. But she said the root cause is still work. She has already been secretly looking for other opportunities, wanting to switch to a more relaxed environment.

Su Lishan: Xiaowei, are you free this weekend? There's a new sci-fi movie that's getting rave reviews. It's said to have twists and turns, and it's mind-bendingly complex! Want to go watch it together?

Yu Xiaowei: Thank you, Shanshan, but I really can't handle movies that are too brain-burning. Work is already mentally exhausting enough; when I watch a movie, I just want to relax and not have to think too much.
Su Lishan: Haha, got it! So what kind of movies do you like? Romantic comedies?

Yu Xiaowei: Yes, light-hearted and funny ones are great. Or inspirational ones like the marathon-themed movie "Run! Dad" from before—they really resonate with me. Otherwise, movies about family and affection are heartwarming to watch.
Su Lishan: OK! I'll invite you again next time there's a movie that suits your taste!
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, Ah Hui (Huang Wenhui) has been extremely busy lately and hasn't had time to speak in the group chat.
Yu Xiaowei: Yeah, I noticed that too. What's going on with her? Did she take on another big project?
Lin Jiaxin: It's not work-related. She bought a new apartment last month in Shenzhen's Nanshan Science and Technology Park area, saying it's close to the company and has a good environment.
Yu Xiaowei: Wow, congratulations to her! So, she must be busy with the renovation now?
Lin Jiaxin: Exactly, running to the building materials market every day, selecting furniture—it’s making my head spin. She said she’ll invite us over for a housewarming once everything is set up.
Su Lishan: Sister Xiaowei, there's a new sci-fi movie coming out this weekend. I heard the special effects are amazing. Do you want to go see it together?

Yu Xiaowei: Sci-fi movies... Sure, that sounds good. It’s nice to relax and enjoy the special effects. Better than watching those suspenseful, mind-bending ones—my brain’s been working all day, and after work, I really don’t want to keep guessing.
Su Lishan: Haha, that's true. Do you enjoy watching family comedies or sports inspirational films? There seem to be a few recently.

Yu Xiaowei: I really enjoy family comedies—they're lighthearted and heartwarming, and sometimes you can even pick up some parenting tips. As for sports inspiration films, it depends. If it’s about running, I’ll definitely be there to support it!
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you heard from Ah Hui? She encountered something bizarre in Shenzhen last week.
Yu Xiaowei: Not yet, what's up? Isn't she working at Nanshan Science and Technology Park?

Lin Jiaxin: That's right. She said a new Hong Kong-style tea restaurant opened in the Southern District of the Science Park, and she went to try their pineapple bun. Then a man came over, called her by name right away, and said he was her high school classmate from Kowloon Tong Secondary School.
Yu Xiaowei: Really? Is there anyone from our graduating class that she doesn't know?

Lin Jiaxin: It's totally fake! Ah Hui has no recollection at all. That guy acted overly familiar, and after chatting for a few minutes, he started promoting some high-return financial plan. Ah Hui immediately became alert, made an excuse to go to the restroom, and left. She said it must be a scam, and she has no idea how he got her name and some basic background information.
Su Lishan: Xiaowei, are you free this weekend? There's a new sci-fi movie out recently, and I heard the special effects are amazing. Want to go see it together?
Yu Xiaowei: Science fiction movies... I can decide after watching the trailers. I actually prefer something lighter, or stories about family and personal growth.
Su Lishan: How about romantic literary films? There's also one with good reviews.

Yu Xiaowei: It's okay to watch romance films occasionally. But please don't ask me to watch horror films—I can't stand the sudden scares at all. After watching them, I wouldn't dare sleep alone at night and would have nightmares.
Su Lishan: Haha, got it! You're a bit timid. What about historical war films? The kind with grand narratives.
Yu Xiaowei: War movies are too heavy and make me feel uncomfortable. Let's forget about them. It seems we need to find a family-friendly or inspirational film.
Lin Jiaxin: Xiaowei, have you heard? Ah Hui has been in a bad mood lately.
Yu Xiaowei: Huh? What's wrong? She hasn't been talking much in our group chat these past few days.
Lin Jiaxin: She told me privately yesterday that she had been preparing for a long time to compete for the position of product director at her company, but she wasn't selected.
Yu Xiaowei: Oh, no wonder. She's so capable, she must be really disappointed. Should we chat with her more in the group over the weekend?
Lin Jiaxin: Alright, I was thinking the same. However, we can't really help with her work matters; all we can do is offer some comfort.
Su Lishan: Sister Xiaowei, how about trying that newly opened icehouse for lunch? I heard their silk stocking milk tea is quite famous.
Yu Xiaowei: Great! But I'm quite picky about milk tea; I've tried many different shops.
Su Lishan: Which one do you like?
Yu Xiaowei: The tea base must be rich and aromatic, with a smooth texture and no residue. Also, the sweetness should be just right—I don't like it too sweet, as it can overpower the tea flavor.
Su Lishan: Got it! The requirements are so detailed, truly worthy of our "milk tea connoisseur." Let's go check out this place's standards at noon.

Weiming, the summer vacation officially starts today, and I have arranged all the children's activities. You work hard, and it's hot outside, so be sure to stay cool and remember to buy some mung beans to make sweet soup tonight.

Weiming, the summer vacation officially starts today, and I have already arranged all the children's activities. You work hard, and it's hot outside, so be sure to stay cool and avoid heatstroke. Remember to buy some mung beans on your way home so we can make sweet soup tonight.
Okay, Manager Zhang, I have already organized the relevant market analysis report at home and will send it to your email before 3 p.m. Working from home is indeed quite efficient.

Lishan, thank you for the conversation during lunch today. It was very inspiring. I have decided to start systematically learning Mandarin, considering my career development, as I want to seize more opportunities. Do you have any recommended online courses or learning platforms?

Shen Peiwen: Xiaowei, see you at the usual spot tomorrow morning! Have you checked all your gear? The weather forecast looks good—looking forward to a long run together!

Me: Yesterday, when I dined at a tea restaurant, I was also charged 1 yuan for the takeaway box. It seems the government is serious about this new regulation this time. For the sake of environmental protection and to save a bit of money, I plan to bring my own lunch box from now on.

I have also attached the relevant policy anniversary review materials. We can go through them in detail tomorrow when we meet at Pacific Coffee. Wishing you a Happy New Year!
Mom: Weiwei, I saw your running plan posted on the bulletin board. It's very detailed! Be safe and don't overexert yourself. Do you need me to prepare any supplies for your weekend run in the park?
Daughter, I'm about to head to the market. Your dad mentioned last night that he wanted to drink that brand of wine. Was it bought at the shop on Yaqianlang Road? I can't quite remember.

Supervisor: Xiaowei, I heard you've been working hard on practicing Mandarin recently. That drive for self-improvement is excellent. Keep it up. Starting next quarter, more communication tasks with high-end mainland clients will be gradually assigned to you.

Nana, that VR headset I tried the other day was absolutely amazing! It really felt like I had traveled to another world, especially the snowy mountain scene. If you're free this weekend, come over to my place and I'll tell you all about it. I feel like this thing is going to change a lot of lifestyles in the future.

Zixuan, summer vacation has started. The weather has been extremely hot lately, so make sure to drink plenty of water when you go out. Don’t play too wildly under the sun, and be careful not to get heatstroke. I’ve signed you and your sister up for swimming classes every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday afternoon. It’s a great way to exercise and cool off. On weekends, we can also go to the beach as a family and enjoy the water.
In response to the government's new policy challenge in April, I brought my lunchbox today! See you at the barbecue shop later.

Weiming: Xiaowei, the more I think about the savings plan we discussed last night, the more reassured I feel. Your careful planning always provides the best security for our family. Let's proceed as you suggested, and together we'll stick to optimizing our expenses.

Weiming, what do you think of the 'Mazu Procession' segment in the House of Dancing Water just now? It was thoughtfully choreographed, integrating Macau's folk culture into a modern stage. I think it's more meaningful than just watching stunts.
I just took a slow walk by the window and took a deep breath, feeling much better now. Let's do our best together in this afternoon's meeting!
【Work Memo】In the morning, sent market updates and holiday greetings to several potential clients (see list in work notes) via WeChat. Marked high-intent clients A and B for follow-up next week.
summarized_info: I sent myself a text message as a reminder, mentioning that I had sent greetings and information to potential clients on WeChat.

message_content: Honey, the doctor said Mom's rehabilitation is going quite well today. I've been thinking lately, besides insurance, shouldn't we also set up an extra financial cushion for our family's health? So I did some research and started a regular investment in a healthcare-themed fund yesterday. It's not much each month, but it's like preparing in advance for potential major health expenses in the future. What do you think?

Weiming, I have recorded the decisions from today's family meeting. Regarding the financial planning for Mom's subsequent recovery and long-term care, I will conduct research as soon as possible and begin exploring stable investment options. This matter is very important for our family and needs to be implemented step by step.

Weiming, I have recorded the decisions made in today's family meeting. This matter is very important for our family and needs to be implemented step by step.
Thank you for the arrangements tonight, Susan. The char siu at Tak Kee is really amazing, and chatting with colleagues was so enjoyable!

We have scheduled a family comprehensive health check-up for everyone at Dr. Zhou's clinic on September 20th at 9:00 AM, which includes a special cardiovascular examination. Please remember to fast and arrive early.
Just finished my morning exercises, my shoulders and neck feel much more relaxed, and I feel a bit calmer, ready to take on the day.

Xiaowei, I understand what you said yesterday. Taking care of your aunt and your family comes first. There’s no rush to go shopping—we can get together once things settle down for your family. Hang in there!
Coach, the morning long-distance running training has been completed, and the data has been synchronized to the APP.
Mom, I just finished today's rehabilitation training. It felt good in the water, and my feet are much more comfortable now.
Honey, dinner might have to wait for me a bit. I'm still at home working on the outline for the podcast interview, trying to finish it before dinner.
Xinxin, I've just finished sketching a lychee pattern and plan to embroider it onto your backpack using Yue embroidery. It symbolizes 'benefiting children' and 'good fortune.' What do you think?
Just had a video chat with Jiaxin about that VR experience, and she was super interested. We've already made plans to try it out together next time.

Hui Hui, thank you for sharing your industry insights tonight. As an insurance agent, I often encounter many cases in my work where families fall into poverty due to illness, so I am particularly sensitive to health risks. I will look further into those biotech companies you mentioned.

Jiaxin, I'm just putting the finishing touches on your birthday gift! This time, I tried creating geometric patterns with embroidery thread on linen. I hope you'll like this wave-patterned coaster—it feels more heartfelt than something store-bought.
This morning's operation went smoothly. The cup is in place.

Weiming, I just practiced by myself and didn't do very well. I'm feeling a bit nervous. I'm worried about the effect tomorrow at the scene, afraid that I might speak too fast and others won't be able to keep up. I still feel unsure.

Peiwen, I had a great time jogging with you this morning! When I showed you my water bottle during stretching, you mentioned it was lightweight and eco-friendly. I remember you were planning to buy one too.

Brother Hua, thank you so much for your guidance this afternoon on the ideas and case selection for my competitive speech over the phone. It was truly inspiring, and I will further digest and organize the content this evening. The success of tonight's banquet is also greatly owed to your support.

Good morning, Teacher Wu! Sorry to bother you. I’ve taken photos of the latest sketches and sent them to you. Please take a look when you have time. I mainly have two questions:  
1. Is there room for improvement in the overall smoothness of the lines?

Thank you very much!
Mom had a good impression of Aunt Wang herself, which was the key reason she finally agreed. The cost was actually secondary.

We have conducted in-depth communication with the client regarding the home insurance plan, and all necessary information has been collected. The client is particularly concerned about the coverage scope.
