I had a video conference with Xu Jiaming from Shenzhen yesterday. I used the Mandarin I've been diligently practicing over the past few months to summarize and discuss throughout the meeting, and the results were unexpectedly good—communication was exceptionally smooth. He immediately agreed to draft the initial version of the cooperation memorandum by next Wednesday, and we also confirmed a face-to-face meeting in July. It feels like all the previous practice was worth it!
Honey, we just finished calculating the fixed expenses and budget framework for February. I've noted down the specific figures in my notebook. Could you take a look and see if this arrangement works?

Mingwei, I barely slept last night and have been with Mom the whole time. Mom is doing okay, waiting for the doctor to come. Please be careful on your way to take Dad to the hospital for his follow-up appointment.

Sister Li, I won't be able to join the walk tonight. I ended up falling asleep while putting the kids to bed. This is already the third time this month that I've had to cancel, and I'm really sorry about it.

Mom, I've been thinking about improving my Cantonese embroidery skills lately. You mentioned before that you know a teacher. Could you ask her if she'd be willing to take on an 'overage student' like me?

I've already asked, Teacher Wu said it's no problem. When you're free, I'll give you his phone number, and you can directly arrange a time with him to go to his studio in Sham Shui Po. He really likes the cat pattern you embroidered.

Xinxin, I spent the whole afternoon learning from Teacher Wu today. She taught a new three-dimensional petal embroidery technique, which is super difficult but the result looks amazing! I feel like it’s going to take a lot of practice.
Wow, impressive! It's on Lai Chi Kok Road in Sham Shui Po, right? Next time we arrange a meal, we could drop by your teacher's studio? Our primary school was nearby, brings back memories.
Coach Zhao, I just saw the notice in the running club group. I have successfully registered for the half marathon next Sunday! Do I need to adjust my training plan for this period?

Great, maintain the current pace, reduce the load three days before the race, and pay attention to carbohydrate intake. The race is on October 18th, so prepare well with the goal of achieving a personal best.
Awen, how did you feel after the run yesterday? My calves are a bit sore, but I finished 8 minutes faster than last year, so I'm really satisfied!

I'm doing okay, but you're too strong! The weather was so nice yesterday, and the run felt great. Shall we resume running at the usual spot next week? Remember to stretch and reward yourself with some Hong Kong-style milk tea you love!

Hey bro, I went to the cha chaan teng today and found they've introduced three new types of pineapple buns: original, coffee, and cheese. I bought all three, and the original is still the most classic. I'll treat you when you're back in Hong Kong.
Sis, you're truly a connoisseur of pineapple buns. The coffee flavor sounds a bit odd. When you come to Shenzhen, I'll take you to try the viral ice-fire pineapple bun here.

Shanshan, the newly opened tea restaurant on Gloucester Road actually serves matcha-flavored pineapple buns! Though it sounds a bit unconventional, as a matcha enthusiast and pineapple bun lover, I've decided to give it a try tomorrow.
Haha, you really know how to find good stuff! Let me know how it tastes after you try it. If it's good, I'll go buy some at noon too, paired with Hong Kong-style milk tea.
A Jie, is there a new model at your car dealership that's been really popular lately? I think I heard a friend mention it.
Yeah, the newly arrived Crown has a very avant-garde design, and orders are already booked until the second half of the year. Are you interested? I can reserve a test drive spot for you.

Ming, my colleague Shan Shan wants to change her car and has taken a liking to the Crown model that Ah Jie mentioned before. I remember you have a friend who works in Crown maintenance? Could you ask about the reputation of that hybrid version?
Okay, I'll ask tomorrow. It seems that the hybrid version saves fuel, but maintenance might be a bit more expensive. Did you ask Ah Jie if there are any discounts?

Mr. Wang, I have prepared the long-term savings plan for your children that you inquired about last time, primarily using one of our participating savings insurance products. Additionally, regarding the high-end medical insurance you mentioned, there are versions available for different regions, and I have compiled a comparison table for you.
Alright, Miss Yu, you're really efficient. I'll be flying to Hong Kong next week. Shall we meet in Central on Thursday afternoon to discuss in detail? I'd like to take a look at both proposals.

Mr. Wang, you previously inquired about accident insurance. We have recently launched a comprehensive accident insurance plan that offers global coverage and includes high-risk sports activities. I believe it would be well-suited to your frequent business trips and occasional mountain climbing. I have sent the relevant information to your email.
Received, thank you, Miss Yu, for your continuous follow-up. This newly added skiing coverage is very practical. I will look into it, as I might be going to Hokkaido next month.

Weiwei, our elementary school is hosting a parent-child fun run event the Saturday after next. You can bring the kids along, and I think Xuanxuan and Xinxin would really enjoy it. Would you like to join us?
Great! That sounds interesting. I'll check with Weiming and the kids about their availability. What date is it?

Ming, tomorrow Ah Wen and I are taking Xuanxuan and Xinxin to their school's parent-child event. After you drop them off at their extracurricular classes in the morning, could you come over for lunch together?
OK, I'll come over after I finish up here. Where should we meet? Remember to tell Mom not to cook lunch for us tomorrow.
Just saw the latest update on the official website—registration for the half marathon I want to run in 2025 is now open! I heard the course has been adjusted, so I need to look into it carefully.
Great! I checked the route map, and it seems the starting point has been changed to the Hong Kong Wetland Park area. The environment should be nice.

For this Saturday's long-distance training, let's meet at the ecological trail around the Wetland Park. It'll also be a good chance to get familiar with the starting point environment for next year's race.
No problem, Coach Zhao! It's a great opportunity to get a feel for the atmosphere in advance. Shall we meet at the park entrance at 7 AM on Saturday?

Teacher Wu, I've been embroidering a 'Pine and Crane for Longevity' piece recently, intending to give it as a special birthday gift. I'm a bit unsure about some of the stitching techniques, so I've taken photos and sent them to you for a look.

Xiaowei, I've received the picture. The density of the pine needles could be more carefully considered, and using the 'tao zhen' technique for the crane's feathers would make them appear more three-dimensional. The thought behind it is truly precious, and the recipient is sure to be delighted.
Mom, your birthday is next month, and I've hand-embroidered a painting for you. I hope you like it. The design features a pine tree and a crane, symbolizing health and longevity.
Sweetie, you're so thoughtful! Even with your busy schedule, you still took the time to do this. Mom will definitely treasure it. Let's just have a simple family dinner on August 22nd.

Hello Ms. Yu, there has been a recent happy event in my family, and the household structure has changed. I would like to schedule a time to discuss with you whether our current family medical and savings insurance policies need any adjustments or upgrades.
Congratulations, Mrs. Chan! Of course. Would next Wednesday at 3 PM at our usual spot, the tea restaurant in Causeway Bay, be convenient for you? I'll prepare a few options for you in advance.

Shanshan, my client Mrs. Chen just sent me a photo. Her little grandson is one month old and so adorable! No wonder she mentioned upgrading her insurance policy earlier—she really has everything planned for the next generation.

Wow, congratulations to her! Nowadays, many clients are purchasing additional insurance or planning for education funds for their grandchildren. You've designed a great plan for her—this deal is as good as done.

Jiaxin, I've met my quarterly performance target and want to reward myself. I've had my eye on that classic brown monogram handbag for a while now. Do you think it would suit me? I've been going back and forth on this for ages.

Of course it's suitable! The LV Neverfull is classic and practical, perfect for carrying your business documents and your child's miscellaneous items. You deserve to reward yourself for all your hard work!

Ming, today I went shopping with Shan Shan, and she strongly recommended that LV handbag I had my eye on before. She said that for us in sales, a good bag is also part of our image. I... am a bit tempted.
Go ahead and buy it if you like it. You work so hard, you deserve to treat yourself. Consider it an early birthday gift from me. If you don’t have enough money, I can help out.
Hey bro, Mom mentioned you're planning to move to a new place in Shenzhen? Have you settled on one yet?

Yes, sister, look, the contract is signed. It's mainly for the convenience of the kids going to school. The environment in this community is quite different from the previous one near the tech park—it's much quieter. Once we've settled in, we'll invite you over for a housewarming!

Mom, Xiaofeng sent the new home address. It's in Longhua District, Shenzhen, very close to the subway station. He said he'll be moving there this weekend. Would it be more convenient for us to go next month?
Longhua District is nice and quiet. Let's wait for them to settle in, and we can all go together during the Easter holiday in April. Remember to remind Weiming to get the car checked.

Brother Hua, regarding the assessment criteria for the promotion to regional manager next year, you mentioned last time that there are strict requirements for quarterly performance. Could you please elaborate on that? I’d like to plan ahead.

Xiaowei, the target is set high, requiring two consecutive quarters of personal performance exceeding HKD 1.5 million, along with an assessment of team management potential. You have the capability, but the pressure is significant, so prepare well.
Honey! The third quarter performance has just been settled, and I achieved 1.52 million! I've met the target for two consecutive quarters! I'm one step closer to the goal!
Great! Congratulations, honey! I knew you could do it! What would you like for dinner tonight? Let's celebrate!
Mom, Xuanxuan's birthday is this month. Time flies, and he's about to turn 10. I want to go to Toys "R" Us this weekend to pick out a surprise gift for him in advance.

Ming, just a reminder that next Friday is Xuanxuan's birthday. I've already reserved a table at the buffet restaurant in Harbour City. Mom and Grandma have both said they'll be coming. Remember to adjust your schedule in advance and avoid working overtime.

Xiaowei, how has your training been going lately? I've been busy preparing for the school sports meet, so I've had less time for my own training. I hope to finish the race at the end of the year smoothly.

Shanshan, I just made plans with my running buddies to practice at the Ma'anshan Seaside Promenade this Sunday. The goal is still the Standard Chartered Hong Kong Marathon Half Marathon at the end of the year, hoping to set a new personal best.

Brother Hua, thank you for your encouragement today! I will definitely strive for the position of Regional Sales Manager. I understand what the key objectives for promotion are, and I will start sprinting toward them from the next quarter.

Shanshan, I'm under so much pressure. Brother Hua said I must achieve the goal of ranking first in the team for three consecutive quarters to have a better chance in the promotion competition. There's only one month left this quarter, so I have to push myself even harder.
Hey little bro, Mom mentioned you've been busy with a big project lately? It's been a while since we last video chatted. How have you been? I bet the baby is starting to crawl now, right?
Yes, sis, I've recently been competing for a senior product director position, and the internal competition is quite intense. The baby is so cute now and loves crawling, full of energy every day.

Ah Hui, my younger brother finally got the promotion he wanted. He's now at Tencent, responsible for a major module of the entire social product line. Next time we go to Shenzhen, we must make him treat us to a big meal to celebrate.

Teacher Wu, how have you been lately? The peony embroidery I’ve been working on is almost finished, but the gradient of the leaves still doesn’t look natural enough. Also, I heard you mentioned last time that you’re busy with an exhibition?

Xiaowei, I'm doing well. I'll teach you how to do the leaf part next time you come to the studio. I'm currently busy preparing for a themed exhibition called 'Lingnan Intangible Cultural Heritage Embroidery and Modern Life' at the Cultural Center, which will open at the end of the year. You must come when it's ready.

Ah Ling, I have some good news to tell you! Teacher Wu has invited me to submit my peony painting for the 'Lingnan Intangible Cultural Heritage Embroidery and Modern Life' exhibition at the end of the year. I'm so nervous, worried that my skills might not be up to par.

Hello Dr. Zhou, this is Yu Xiaowei. My annual physical examination report has come out, and there are a few indicators I'd like you to review for me. Additionally, regarding my long-term running, you mentioned last time that I could undergo a more targeted examination to ensure safety?

Hello, Miss Yu. I've reviewed the report, and it looks generally good. Regarding the intensity of your marathon training, I suggest you consider undergoing a cardiac stress echocardiogram (exercise electrocardiogram) to assess your heart's function and blood supply during physical activity. This will provide greater peace of mind.
Mom, don't worry. I've completed the cardiac stress test recommended by Dr. Zhou, and the results are all normal. He said I can continue running my marathons with peace of mind.

Mom, do you remember that your and Dad's wedding anniversary is coming up? Wei Ming and I have been discussing and thought of giving you a piece of gold jewelry this year, to wish you peace and good health. What do you think would be better, a bracelet or a necklace?

Awei, that's so thoughtful of you! Gold jewelry is too precious, and I don't really wear such things often. Actually, after I sprained my foot last time, I thought the massage device that our neighbor Mrs. Zhang used was quite nice. But whatever you and Weiming give us, your dad and I will be happy.
Today, my mom told me that my grandmother actually doesn't care much for jewelry. The jade bracelet I gave her years ago was rarely worn. Luckily, you asked her about it.

Yes, good thing I asked. Otherwise, it would have ended up like the bird's nest from previous years, sitting there until it expired. So this year for our anniversary, let's just follow her suggestion and buy a massager.

Ah Wei, I have a question for you. I want to buy a small coffee machine for home use. It should be easy to operate, convenient to clean, and preferably capable of brewing black coffee. Do you have any brand or model recommendations? I'm overwhelmed by the options online.

Xiaowei, I recommend the Nescafé Dolce Gusto series. It offers a wide variety of capsules, ranging from lattes to cappuccinos. The machine has a stylish design, operates with just one button, and is easy to clean. It works well in my home.

Shanshan, I remember you mentioned that your family also uses a capsule coffee machine? Is it the Nescafé Dolce Gusto? Does it not make pure black coffee (Americano)? I mainly want to drink black coffee without any additives.

Yes, that's the one. It doesn't make plain American-style coffee, only those with milk foam or fancy styles. If you want black coffee, you need to buy an Italian-style machine that uses coffee beans or ground coffee, or the simplest way is to use a pour-over or a French press.
Ah Wei, I accidentally twisted my ankle while shopping at the street market this morning, and now it's red and swollen, making it painful to walk.

Grandma, don't move for now. Quickly wrap an ice pack with a towel and apply it to the area. If you have some medicated oil at home, gently massage it in, but be careful not to use too much force. I'll come see you as soon as I finish work. If the pain becomes severe, call an ambulance.
Grandma, is your foot feeling better? Is the swelling still there?
Much better, the swelling has gone down a bit, but there's still some bruising. I plan to use some medicated oil to massage it again tomorrow.

Stop! I recently asked my yoga instructor, and he said that for the first two or three days after a sprain, you should apply ice. After that, if the swelling subsides and there is bruising, you should use heat to promote blood circulation. Products like medicated oils can also be used after the acute phase, but the application should be gentle. It's best to consult a doctor or physical therapist first. Don't go to the market for now; rest at home.
Mr. Wu, long time no see! I heard that your work has been selected for this year's Hong Kong Craft Exhibition. Congratulations!

Thank you, Xiaowei. It was recommended by the association—a double-sided embroidery titled "Morning Melody of Victoria Harbour." The specific date and venue for the exhibition haven’t been finalized yet. I’ll let you know once it’s confirmed, and you’re welcome to come and take a look if you have time.

Xinxin, have you seen the news? The 'Hong Kong Traditional Craft Revitalisation Programme Achievements Exhibition' opened today at the Hong Kong City Hall Exhibition Hall! There's a Cantonese embroidery section, and it seems to include works by Teacher Wu. Should we make plans to go with Ah Hui this weekend?

Great, great! I saw the announcement last week and was just about to ask you. I'll check if Ahui is free to come over from Shenzhen this weekend. Teacher Wu will definitely be thrilled to know we're going.

Awen, I'm thinking of getting a new sports watch, mainly for monitoring heart rate and tracking routes during runs, and I'd prefer one with good battery life. How do you feel about the Garmin you're using? Any specific model recommendations?

I'm using the Garmin Forerunner 245, an older model but very durable. The new version is the 265, which adds an AMOLED screen and more sports modes, and I hear the battery life is also good. Alternatively, you could check out Suunto, but I think Garmin's running data analysis is more professional.

Xiaowei, I couldn't resist the temptation and got myself a Garmin 265 as well! The screen is absolutely stunning, and it has so many features. From now on, we can add each other as friends on Garmin Connect and keep an eye on each other's training progress!
Haha, a person of action! It seems I need to speed up on my homework too. Share your thoughts after you've used it for a while.

Mrs. Chan, the weather has been quite changeable lately, so please take good care of yourself and your family. I recall you mentioned last time that you still had a bit of a cough. Are you feeling better now?

Miss Yu is very thoughtful. I still have a bit of a cough, especially at night—it hurts so much that my ribs ache. I went to see a general practitioner, who prescribed some medication, but it hasn’t completely gone away.

You should be careful if you've been coughing for so long. Our family doctor is quite well-known for treating respiratory issues. He works at the Hong Kong Sanatorium & Hospital and is very attentive. If you need, I can give you his contact information so you can see him and hopefully feel better.

Miss Yu, thank you so much for introducing Dr. Zhou Wenbin. He examined me very thoroughly and said it was allergic cough combined with mild bronchitis. He prescribed new medication and an inhaler, and after using them for a few days, I feel much better. I really appreciate it!
That's wonderful, Mrs. Chen! I'm glad Dr. Zhou was able to help you. I feel relieved knowing you're recovering. Take good care of yourself!

Wenhui, thank you for taking the time tonight to listen to me ramble on for so long. It feels much better to finally get all these things off my chest—the issues with caring for my mom, the financial pressures at home, and the guilt and neglect I feel toward Jiahao. The app you recommended and the step-by-step advice are especially helpful, and I’ll start looking into them tomorrow. It’s so good to have you.
Honey, I got some air conditioner refrigerant from the company, and I'll fix the AC tonight.

Teacher Li: Hello, Zixuan's mom, thank you for your hard work during today's classroom observation. If it's convenient for you now, could we go to the office to briefly discuss Zixuan's recent situation?

Xiaowei, today's gathering was very fruitful! The insurance concepts you mentioned really got me thinking. I'd like to learn more about employee benefit plans—could you reach out when it's convenient?

Weiming, for tonight's dinner, I plan to proactively guide the conversation and share topics, just like we did when celebrating for our parents, to make the interaction more lively. What do you think?
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowei sent a text message to her husband, suggesting that they guide the conversation by imitating previous celebrations during dinner.

message_content: Xiaofeng, your mother hasn't been sleeping well these past few nights, so I have to stay with her all the time. During the day, I feel groggy and utterly exhausted.
Weiming: During the meeting, we emphasized risk avoidance, such as potential income uncertainty and unexpected large expenses, so the protection component should be prioritized.

Honey, about what we just discussed regarding our anniversary, I've thought it over. This year, let's just have a simple meal together and prioritize Mom's needs. We can talk about traveling another time. What do you think?
Honey, when I picked up our daughter today, the music teacher specifically talked to me. She said our daughter has a great sense of rhythm, strong imitation skills, and a lot of talent!
Xiaowei: Shan, I just finished registering and paying for an advanced workshop on my phone during lunch break. Now I'm waiting for the confirmation email. I'm so excited!
Chen Meiling: Xiaowei, today in the kitchen, we talked about strolling through Kowloon Walled City Park. Those old photos really bring back memories.

Yu Xiaofeng: Sis, regarding your RSUs, my suggestion is not to handle them all at once. It would be better to sell them in batches based on market conditions when they vest, and be sure to avoid the company's financial report release periods to reduce volatility risks. We can make further plans after the funds are repatriated to Hong Kong.

Weiming: Honey, I've given serious thought to the community lecture. Your experience in taking care of Mom is truly valuable, and I think it would be especially meaningful if you could share it to help others in similar situations. Don't be afraid—I'm sure you'll do a great job. Both the baby and I fully support you.
Su Lishan, good morning! See you at 9 o'clock in the meeting room to discuss today's seminar preparations.
Yu Xiaowei: Finally settled with Jiaxin yesterday. We decided to give gifts for birthdays instead of having dinner parties, as we feel it's more meaningful this way.
Su Lishan: Xiaowei, the portable folding cup you shared during lunch today is so convenient! I'm planning to buy one too. Thanks for your eco-friendly suggestion!
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowei received a text message from her colleague Su Lishan, mentioning the eco-friendly practice of sharing portable folding cups during lunch.

message_content: I've started systematically sorting through my growth history, digging out many old items to use in my speech at my alma mater.

(Family Group: Warm Family)  
Me: @everyone Let me summarize the meeting just now. Based on our discussion, this Greater Bay Area trip is officially confirmed to be arranged with the two main themes of "Root-Seeking" and "Parent-Child" activities! The ancestral hometown information provided by Dad will serve as the core of the root-seeking segment, and the science museum and amusement park that Zixuan and Yuxin want to visit will also be included. The budget framework will be based on the version I estimated this afternoon. Does anyone have any objections?  

Weiming: No objections. The themes are clear, and the budget is manageable. Sounds good.  

Zixuan: Yay!  

Yuxin: Agreed!  

Dad (Yu Guoqiang): That works. This arrangement is meaningful.  

Mom (Chen Meiling): Alright, let’s finalize it this way.
Honey, the car insurance renewal has just been completed. I've saved the electronic policy and sent it to your email. Please check it when you have a moment.
Afternoon tasks initiated, starting with renewal and consultation processing.
【Hang Seng Bank】Dear customer, your property tax payment notice has been issued. Please check and handle it promptly. For details, please visit: www.hangseng.com
Awen, I recently watched a BBC documentary that was truly captivating, and I highly recommend it. We can discuss it the next time we meet.
Mom, I have a new idea about decorating the backpack. Can we talk about it tonight?

【Hang Seng Bank】Dear customer, you have successfully set up a "Global Healthcare Fund" regular investment plan with a monthly investment amount of HKD 2,000. The first deduction date is 2025-04-10. Please ensure sufficient balance in your account.
